h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Champagne?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle, brut style (dry), sparkling wine; no added mixers or garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sweetness level (brut, demi-sec), alcohol content, and serving size. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of brut champagne has about 615 calories, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Rose champagne (similar but with slight fruit notes)

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of brut champagne?
faqs.a: About 615 kcal for a standard 750 ml bottle.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a bottle of champagne?
faqs.a: Roughly 19.5 g total carbs, mostly sugars, in 750 ml brut.

faqs.q: Does champagne have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Negligible fat (0 g) and very low protein (~0.75 g) per bottle.

faqs.q: How does sweetness affect calories in champagne?
faqs.a: Drier styles like brut have fewer calories; sweeter demi-sec adds ~150 kcal per bottle.
Brut is relatively low at ~2.6 g carbs per 100 ml, but totals add up in a full bottle.
